name: Albergo Cesari

reviews.text: Top marks for the excellent location (close to Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Colosseum, etc),very clean rooms, extremely helpful front desk staff (restaurant suggestions were all great) and the rooftop terrace was a lovely spot to eat breakfast and to enjoy a late afternoon cocktail. We would absolutely stay there again.
reviews.title: Rooftop terrace was the tops!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hotel was superb. It was our first trip to Rome and the location can't be beat. It is steps from the Trevi Fountain and other major attractions. The only time we took a cab was when we went to Vatican City - otherwise, get lost in the streets and enjoy this wonderful city. The Hotel was extremely clean and very roomy - despite the fact that Europe is know for tiny accommodations we found our room to be large and bathroom equally roomy. The rooftop bar is a perfect way to relax after a day of sightseeing. Thanks for a wonderful Stay!
reviews.title: Awesome Location, great Accomdation.

reviews.text: We were disappointed with this hotel. It needs updating. The carpet is disgusting, the food is mediocre, and the rooms are just ok. Also, the staff was not as hospitable as another hotel we stayed at in Rome. I would not return.
reviews.title: There are better places to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you to the staff at the Caesari ! After checking out we had to wait for 8 hours for our children to arrive in Rome before heading to Florence. The staff were very accommodating - they allowed us to stow our luggage and, in the heat of the day, relax in the rooftop lounge at no extra cost. in addition to its perfect location,our room was clean, spacious and very comfortable; the breakfast sublime. If we are lucky enough to return to Rome we will definitely use this hotel again. Jacquie and Peter Tarr, Namibia.
reviews.title: A really great hotel in an ideal locality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is 100% true that this is a great location. Everything was within walking distance. We walked every where (Pantheon, Piazza Navonna, Campo di Fiore, Forum , spanish steps etc...) The hotel staff at the front desk was wonderful!! I can't remember his name but he worked evenings (maybe nights) at the front desk. He gave us wonderful recommendations for dining and was so friendly. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. We enjoyed drinks at the roof top bar on night. I would not hesitate to stay here again!
reviews.title: When I come back I'm staying here!

reviews.text: Great hotel, great location, great staff.
reviews.title: Would DEFINITELY Return

reviews.text: I stayed in a HUGE quad room with four twin beds. With four women traveling together, we were nervous that the space would be too small. In fact, it was huge and had two closets, two side tables, two huge chairs, a desk, a sitting chair and a tv stand in addition to the beds! There's also a small fridge with snacks inside, but room to store your own goodies.
reviews.title: Great location lovely hotel
Fantastic Central Location
reviews.text: The bathroom was really nice, though we did have some occassional issues flushing the toilet. They sent someone up to fix it. The air conditioning worked flawlessly. Most times, we were too cold and had to adjust it! This was especially important in HOT August.

The rooftop breakfast was absolutely stunning visually with great service. Unfortunately, we never made it back up for drinks in the evening. The friendly staff also helped us with directions, restaurant recommendations and reservations. They also tried to help us trouble shoot our calling card, which decided to stop working. There's a computer terminal in the lobby for free use by guests.
reviews.title: The rooftop terrace makes this hotel a winner!

reviews.text: The location can't be beat. It's a five minute walk to the Pantheon or the Trevi Fountain. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby. You can walk to a lot of places, since you're in the heart of the historic center.
reviews.title: Terrific location and helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked 2 nights at the Albergo Cesari.
reviews.title: Location, nice rooms and excellent staff!

reviews.text: There are many good things to mention about this tourist hotel like:
reviews.title: Not worth the money! Better hotels nearby for half the price.

reviews.text: Location
reviews.title: Fun hotel, great staff, amazing location...definitely would return!

reviews.text: Good rooms
reviews.title: Can't say enough

reviews.text: Very good breakfast
reviews.title: Italian Feel, International Comfort, Unbeatable Location

reviews.text: This was our 2nd stay at the Albergo Cesari in Rome, this time bringing our son and his 18 yr old daughter celebrating her high school graduation. Our rooms on the 2nd floor were spacious with comfortable beds, powerful bathroom shower and great breakfast on the roof top patio. Same day laundry saved our wardrobes as we took with us very little in small carry-on bags.
reviews.title: Once Again, the Cesari is Wonderful!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We walked everywhere and this time we actually found a restaurant which is affiliated with the hotel within a 2 minute walk. The Taverna Antonino fed us lunch and dinner well on 2 different days. We stayed for a week. Our thanks to Jan, Bernardo and Tomasso for their hospitality at reception and their ready answers to our many questions and of course Luigi at the Taverna for his great service and wonderful smile :)
reviews.title: As they all say...a great spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely be staying here again and highly recommend the hotel to our friends!
reviews.title: Superb!

reviews.text: We spent 4 nights at the Cesari at the begining of June. When we first arrived there was a problem with our booking, not sure whos fault it was, the hotel or our travel agent but we were only booked in for 3 nights instead of 4. We arrived too early to check in and we were asked if we could come back in a couple of hours. By the time we got back they had sorted out the problem with the booking and all was well.
reviews.title: A great place to stay in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was OK , no view from the window as it was in the middle of the hotel. The shower in the bathroom was tiny. I am a large person but not overly so and I had problems turning around. Any one over 100kg would not fit in it.
reviews.title: Great Service, Great Location!

description: Between Fontana di Trevi and the Pantheon. The 47 rooms are elegantly furnished and provide a complete range of amenities and facilities. No smoking floors. Buffet breakfast and trendy bar on the roof garden. Private garage nearby at extra cost.
